intro: Randia submontana, commonly known as the mountain randia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Randia submontana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
